prop1.text: What tags are recommended and/or required?
prop1.tooltip:
How tags work:

The tags in a page work as content identifiers that help dynamically driven modules like the M.10.0b - Dynamic Link List or the M.5.0 - Horizontal List Module (HLM) display relevant content.

These components will search all pages within the same CCTLD country site which are tagged with the current pages self-tag, rank and sort them and display those deemed most relevant.

For example, if the current page should be considered for inclusion in a dynamic module on the Safety & Protection Industry page, set the Industry:Safety & Protection tag in the tags field of the current page.

Additionally, certain tags must be set on every page because they are reported to Omniture/Site Catalyst for evaluation of site user interaction. If these tags are not set, then no information is sent back to the reporting suits.

Required tags for a page are:

  • Brands
  • Business Unit
  • Corporate Landing
  • Industry
  • Megatrend
  • PCG
  • Products
  • Uses and Applications.

The page may be tagged multiple times with the same tag. For example, a page may be tagged to multiple industries, PCGâ€™s, products, etc.
